meanings.definition: Akelas (noun): a type of wolf in the Jungle Book
meanings.sent1: In the story, the akelas were wise and protective wolves.
meanings.sent2: The pack of akelas roamed the jungle together, looking out for each other.
meanings.sent3: The akelas in the book had a special howl that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style was like that of the akelas, strong and caring.
meanings.sent5: The image of the akelas standing proudly under the moonlight stayed with him.

meanings.definition: Akelas (verb): third person singular present of akela
meanings.sent1: He akelas every morning before heading out for his run.
meanings.sent2: She akelas with determination, never giving up on her goals.
meanings.sent3: The way he akelas around the house always makes his family smile.
meanings.sent4: Her words akelas through the room, leaving a sense of calm in their wake.
meanings.sent5: The music akelas softly in the background, creating a soothing atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Akelas (adjective): relating to or characteristic of akela
meanings.sent1: Her akelas leadership style inspired everyone in the group.
meanings.sent2: The akelas qualities of loyalty and bravery shone through in his actions.
meanings.sent3: The room was decorated in an akelas theme, with pictures of wolves everywhere.
